meanings.definition: To outwit or defeat by being more clever or skillful.
meanings.sent1: The clever fox outmaneuvered the hunter by hiding in the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The detective outmaneuvered the criminal by setting a clever trap.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat outmaneuvered the dog in a playful game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The chess player outmaneuvered their opponent by sacrificing a pawn to win the game.
meanings.sent5: The cunning spy outmaneuvered the enemy by using disguises and secret codes.

meanings.definition: To surpass in maneuvering or strategy.
meanings.sent1: The skilled pilot outmaneuvered the enemy planes in a daring dogfight.
meanings.sent2: The captain outmaneuvered the pirates by navigating through treacherous waters.
meanings.sent3: The soccer team outmaneuvered their opponents by passing the ball with precision.
meanings.sent4: The general outmaneuvered the enemy army by launching a surprise attack from the rear.
meanings.sent5: The race car driver outmaneuvered the competition on the final lap to win the championship.
